duties_responsibilities.duty: Apply engineering concepts to optimize equipment, procedures, and departmental budgets to achieve better Maintainability Reliability, and availability of equipment.
Plan, evaluate, organize, and implement installation, maintenance, and repair activities to minimize downtime and maximize safety of employees.
Coordinate maintenance project schedule, prepare project status reports, and secure appropriate resources for projects.
Drive asset care and Total Productive Maintenance strategies, lead maintenance planning, and process procedure improvements using reliability tools.
Manage predictive maintenance programs including Thermal Scanning, Ultrasonic, and Vibration monitoring to ensure compliance with established standards.
Analyze predictive maintenance data, review engineering specs, and design modifications to process equipment for reliability capability.
Perform and lead Failure Mode Equipment Analyses (FMEA's), conduct root cause analysis, and ensure timely and high-quality Professional Maintenance (PM).
Develop and maintain standard operating and maintenance procedures, maintain records of plant and equipment performance, and prepare and maintain data sheets and diagrams.
Review entire projects, assist in capital project management, maintain communications with project stakeholders, determine project staffing needs, and manage project staff.
Continuous evaluation of workplace for safety concerns, support for safety initiatives, adherence to plant rules and safety regulations, and coordination with other departments.
Provide input for the maintenance budget, support autonomous maintenance through training of operators, and ensure equipment basic conditions are maintained throughout the plant.
